channel.title: PgBouncer Concepts on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes
channel.description: Recent content in PgBouncer Concepts on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes

item.title: AppBinding CRD
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. AppBinding What is AppBinding An AppBinding is a Kubernetes CustomResourceDefinition(CRD) which points to an application using either its URL (usually for a non-Kubernetes resident service instance) or a Kubernetes service object (if self-hosted in a Kubernetes cluster), some optional parameters and a credential secret. To learn more about AppBinding and the problems it solves, please read this blog post: The case for AppBinding.

item.title: PgBouncer CRD
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. This is an Enterprise-only feature. Please install KubeDB Enterprise Edition to try this feature. PgBouncer What is PgBouncer PgBouncer is a Kubernetes Custom Resource Definitions (CRD). It provides declarative configuration for PgBouncer in a Kubernetes native way. You only need to describe the desired configurations in a PgBouncer object, and the KubeDB operator will create Kubernetes resources in the desired state for you.

item.title: PgBouncerVersion CRD
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. This is an Enterprise-only feature. Please install KubeDB Enterprise Edition to try this feature. PgBouncerVersion What is PgBouncerVersion PgBouncerVersion is a Kubernetes Custom Resource Definitions (CRD). It provides a declarative configuration to specify the docker images to be used for PgBouncer server deployed with KubeDB in a Kubernetes native way. When you install KubeDB, a PgBouncerVersion custom resource will be created automatically for every supported PgBouncer release versions.
